intro: Schistostigma papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan schistostigma, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
